blurb:
In 2022, Black students had an average score that was 27 points lower than that for
White students.
• In 2022, Hispanic students had an average score that was 19 points lower than that
for White students.
• In 2022, male students in Alabama had an average score that was lower than that for
female students by 10 points.
• In 2022, students who were eligible for the National School Lunch Program (NSLP)
had an average score that was 24 points lower than that for students who were not
eligible.

• Data are not reported for Black students in 2022, because reporting standards were
not met.
• In 2022, Hispanic students had an average score that was not significantly different
from that for White students.
• In 2022, male students in Alaska had an average score that was lower than that for
female students by 13 points.
• In 2022, students who were eligible for the National School Lunch Program (NSLP)
had an average score that was 30 points lower than that for students who were not
eligible.

• In 2022, Black students had an average score that was 23 points lower than that for
White students.
• In 2022, Hispanic students had an average score that was 24 points lower than that
for White students.
• In 2022, male students in Arizona had an average score that was not significantly
different from that for female students.
• In 2022, students who were eligible for the National School Lunch Program (NSLP)
had an average score that was 25 points lower than that for students who were not
eligible.

• In 2022, Black students had an average score that was 33 points lower than that for
White students.
• In 2022, Hispanic students had an average score that was 20 points lower than that
for White students.
• In 2022, male students in Arkansas had an average score that was lower than that for
female students by 9 points.
• In 2022, students who were eligible for the National School Lunch Program (NSLP)
had an average score that was 34 points lower than that for students who were not
eligible.
California is a cultural and economic powerhouse, home to Hollywood and Silicon Valley.
Colorado is famous for its Rocky Mountains and outdoor recreational activities.
Connecticut is known for its charming small towns and prestigious educational institutions.
Delaware is the first state to ratify the US Constitution and has a rich colonial history.
Florida is famous for its sunny beaches, theme parks, and vibrant tourism industry.
Georgia is known for its peaches, diverse landscapes, and historical significance in the South.
Hawaii offers stunning beaches, unique culture, and breathtaking volcanic landscapes.
Idaho is celebrated for its rugged landscapes, outdoor adventures, and potato production.
Illinois is home to Chicago, a major hub for finance, culture, and architecture.
Indiana is known for its automotive industry and the famous Indianapolis 500 race.
Iowa features expansive farmlands and is a key player in the US agricultural sector.
Kansas is characterized by its vast plains and significant role in American aviation history.
Kentucky is famous for the Kentucky Derby, horse racing, and bourbon production.
Louisiana is known for its vibrant Creole culture, music, and the city of New Orleans.
Maine offers picturesque coastlines, lighthouses, and is famous for its lobster.
Maryland is known for its Chesapeake Bay, maritime history, and proximity to Washington D.C.
Massachusetts is rich in American history and home to prestigious universities like Harvard.
Michigan is renowned for its automotive industry and the beautiful Great Lakes.
Minnesota is known for its thousands of lakes, vibrant arts scene, and the Twin Cities.
Mississippi has a rich musical heritage and is pivotal in the history of blues music.
Missouri is home to the Gateway Arch and a diverse mix of cultural and natural attractions.
Montana offers stunning national parks, including Glacier National Park and vast wilderness.
Nebraska is known for its prairies, agriculture, and the unique Sandhills region.
Nevada is famous for Las Vegas, desert landscapes, and vibrant nightlife.
New Hampshire is celebrated for its picturesque landscapes and the first primary in US elections.
New Jersey is known for its beaches, bustling urban areas, and significant contributions to music.
New Mexico is renowned for its desert landscapes, Native American culture, and artistic heritage.
New York is home to New York City, the Statue of Liberty, and diverse cultural landmarks.
North Carolina offers a mix of mountains, beaches, and a strong research and development sector.
North Dakota is known for its Great Plains, agriculture, and growing energy sector.
Ohio is a key industrial state with a rich history in manufacturing and innovation.
Oklahoma is known for its oil industry, Native American heritage, and vibrant music scene.
Oregon features diverse landscapes from the Pacific coastline to lush forests and mountains.
Pennsylvania is rich in American history, home to Philadelphia and the Liberty Bell.
Rhode Island is the smallest US state, known for its coastal towns and maritime heritage.
South Carolina is famed for its historic cities, beautiful beaches, and southern hospitality.
South Dakota is home to Mount Rushmore and expansive prairie landscapes.
Tennessee is known for its vibrant music scene, including Nashville's country music heritage.
Texas is the second-largest state, known for its diverse culture, energy industry, and barbecue.
Utah boasts stunning national parks, vibrant cities like Salt Lake City, and rich pioneer history.
Vermont is celebrated for its green mountains, maple syrup, and charming small towns.
Virginia is steeped in American history and offers a mix of beaches, mountains, and cities.
Washington is home to Seattle, lush forests, and a thriving technology sector.
West Virginia is known for its Appalachian Mountains, outdoor activities, and coal mining history.
Wisconsin is famous for its dairy production, especially cheese, and vibrant cultural festivals.
Wyoming is home to Yellowstone National Park and vast open landscapes.
